description: Secure your application using Laravel's robust authentication system.

slides.title: Authentication Made Easy üîê
slides.content:
# Built-in Features

Laravel provides out-of-the-box support for authentication.

Everything from Login, Registration, Password Reset, to Email Verification is handled via Starter Kits.

slides.title: Laravel Breeze
slides.content:
# Quick Start üå¨Ô∏è

A minimal, simple implementation of all of Laravel's authentication features.

`composer require laravel/breeze --dev`
`php artisan breeze:install`

Generates views, routes, and controllers automatically.

slides.title: Manually Authenticating
Protecting Routes
slides.content:
# Middleware üõ°Ô∏è

Restrict access to authenticated users only.

`Route::get('/dashboard', function () { ... })->middleware('auth');`

Unauthenticated users are redirected to login.

slides.title: Retrieving User
slides.content:
# Who is it? üë§

Get the currently authenticated user.

`$user = Auth::user();`

Get just the ID:
`$id = Auth::id();`

slides.title: Middleware Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Which middleware alias is used to ensure a user is logged in?

slides.title: Gates
Policies
slides.content:
# Organized Logic üëÆ

A class dependent on a Model used to organize authorization logic.

`php artisan make:policy PostPolicy --model=Post`

Contains methods like `view`, `create`, `update`, `delete`.

slides.title: Authorize in Controller
slides.content:
# Controller Helper üéÆ

Controllers have an `authorize` method.

`$this->authorize('update', $post);`

Automatically throws 403 HTTP Access Denied if generic.

slides.title: Blade Authorization
slides.content:

slides.title: Sanctum
slides.content:
# API Tokens ü™ô

For SPAs or Mobile Apps.

`$token = $user->createToken('token-name');`

Simple token-based authentication system.

slides.title: Concept Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: When should you prefer a Policy over a Gate?
quizOptions: When the logic is simple and generic
When you are authorizing actions related to a specific Model
When you don't have a database

slides.title: Summary
slides.content:
# Recap: Auth üîê

Secure your app.

- **Breeze:** Starter kit.
- **Middleware:** `auth`.
- **Gates:** Simple checks.
- **Policies:** Model-based checks.
- **Sanctum:** API Tokens.
